word_mean: 显微镜：能使微小物体影像放大、洞悉肉眼无从窥视的结构细节的仪器

sentence.Network_cn: 我们把显微镜对准了一个看起来合适的目标。

sentence.Network_en: The microscope contains a few hundred dollars-worth of electronic bits and bobs.
sentence.Network_cn: 这架显微镜内有价值数百美元的电子元件。

sentence.Network_en: The media put their every decision under the microscope.
sentence.Network_cn: 媒体仔细研究了他们的每一个决定。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from modern Latin microscopium (see micro-, -scope)

entry.def: A microscope is a scientific instrument which makes very small objects look bigger so that more detail can be seen.

entry.tran: （通常由于被认为存在问题)被仔细研究
entry.def: If you say that something is under the microscope, you mean that it is being studied very closely, usually because it is believed that something is wrong with it.

example.ex: The media put their every decision under the microscope.
example.tran: 媒体仔细研究了他们的每一个决定。

means.word_mean: 1. magnifier of the image of small objects;

sentences.sentence: "the invention of the microscope led to the discovery of the cell"
